results.title: ServiceNow / Tanium Integration Developer
results.description:
This job is fully remote and candidates must reside in the US.


About Chuco

Chuco provides managed and professional services to Tanium customers across North America and Europe. We provide Tanium expertise to small customers as well as Fortune 100 enterprises across a multitude of industries. Our staff focuses on both operations and security use cases and ensures the smooth operation of the Tanium platform.


Chuco has been in operation since 2016, but has more Tanium experience than anyone outside of Tanium. We have a uniquely strong and direct relationship with Tanium, and we focus on developing deep expertise in the Tanium platform.

We have a dispersed presence across the United States and allow for remote work. We rely on a strong, team-focused culture that lets individuals thrive via remote communication. We have a range of responsibilities that encompass individual customers and multiple managed customer needs.


Job Description

As a ServiceNow Developer, you will be responsible for building and maintaining solutions for Chuco’s customers. Primary duties will revolve around integrations with the Tanium core platform and its various modules. Working alongside Chuco Tanium Consultants you will be responsible for planning, development, test, and support of all aspects of both custom and vendor-provided solutions.

Requirements

Must Have

  • 4+ Years of ServiceNow development experience
  • 4+ Years of JavaScript and related web technologies
  • Full stack (client- and server-side) understanding of application development
  • Experience with integration between ServiceNow and other systems/platforms using both mid servers and cloud to cloud
  • Background with REST API and GraphQL
  • Proven experience with implementingServiceNow CMDB, ITSM, Service Catalog, and Workflows to meet business requirements
  • Knowledge of all aspects of ServiceNow scripting including Business Rules, Client Scripts, UI Pages, Scripted REST APIs, and Script Includes
  • Ability to create technical design documents and user documentation
  • Collaborate closely with vendors, customers, and internal staff
  • At least two ServiceNow Certifications - Application Developer and System Administrator preferred
  • Experience with Agile or other software development methodologies
  • Create scoped applications to solve specific business needs

Nice to Have

  • Experience with the Tanium platform
  • Endpoint management experience including patching, software distribution, and asset management
  • Other scripting languages including PowerShell, VBScript, Python, Linux Shell scripting

Personality Traits

  • Has strong customer service skills with a friendly personal demeanor.
  • Is a resourceful, disciplined self-starter with strong analytical and troubleshooting abilities.
  • Takes pride in doing a great job.
  • Is thorough and detail oriented.
  • Maintains professionalism under pressure and can multitask.
  • Has strong research skills can find answers to any question no matter how difficult.


Benefits

  • Base compensation commensurate with certification and experience
  • Time off is not tracked or limited - as long as customers are happy, unlimited PTO is permitted.
  • Health and dental insurance (100% individual, 50% dependent)
  • Hands-on Tanium training

results.title: Software Engineer, Full Stack
results.description:
Memorisely is a virtual learning campus on a mission to make learning accessible and enjoyable. Our Live coding and UX/UI Design Bootcamp help designers and developers around the world learn the latest skills in a micro class. With our mission to make learning accessible, we're building an on-demand web application with micro classes for designers and devs to learn anywhere, anytime.

 

We’re hiring a Full-stack Software Engineer to join our Product Team to help us build our on-demand learning app with the latest web technologies: AWS, Next.js, Typescript, Tailwind, Strapi, Stripe, and tRPC. As a member of our remote team, you'll also spend time contributing to our coding curriculums. This role is a balance between building and sharing your knowledge with a community of 500,000+ in over 150+ countries.

 

  • Location: Remote (Europe Timezone)
  • Full-time

Requirements

As a Full Stack Software Engineer, you’ll...

  • Build features on a product team enabling visually developed asynchronous workflows
  • Write performant and accessible UI components (Next.js)
  • Collaborate with software engineers, product managers, and product designers in a supportive team environment
  • Build and maintain unit and integration tests (Cypress)
  • Mentor other engineers on best practices, code design considerations, and quality
  • Improve our planning, development, and deployment processes to help you and your fellow team members
  • Unite our front and back-end services

 

When you're not contributing to our product team, you'll collaborate with our education team to create curriculums for developers to learn the latest front and back-end skills. We think it's a pretty cool role that has you building and sharing your knowledge. That said, these role responsibilities are just the start! At Memorisely, we encourage you to contribute wherever your interests take you — and shape your role accordingly.

 

About you

You’ll thrive as a Software Engineer at Memorisely if you:

  • Have previous engineering experience in scalable, multi-tenant environments that drive rich front-end experiences.
  • Have developed a scalable SaaS product or service that builds customer trust through accessible and reliable user experiences
  • Value testing and documentation as much as you do code
  • Are comfortable with ambiguity and scoping solutions with your teammates
  • Have consistently communicated trade-offs throughout a project to meet both technical and business requirements
  • Get excited about encouraging and developing earlier-career engineers
  • Comfortable sharing your knowledge of coding and experience in educating your team
  • A brilliant communicator and love sharing good energy with your team

No stress if you don't meet 100% of the responsibilities listed. We'd still love to read your application and get to know you during interviews.

Benefits

  • Life is busy and we ensure you work the hours that fit your lifestyle
  • Get stretchy with the team during yoga sessions
  • Monthly budget to work anywhere but home!
  • Full remote role and we encourage travel
  • Competitive salary
  • Work with a super friendly team around the world
  • 30 days holiday
  • Annual company meet-up somewhere amazing around the world
  • Join community meetups to meet amazing designers and devs around the world

results.title: Developer
results.description:
Teal Media is seeking an enthusiastic developer for a full-time position. You will help bring our award-winning designs to life working along a dedicated team of designers and developers.

  • Ideal Location: Remote (US residents only)

Who We Are

Teal Media is a full-service creative and design agency with a conscience. We believe purposeful design can transform organizations, inspire action, and enable progress. Our clients and nonprofit partners commit their lives to creating positive social change. We pour every ounce of our passion and skill into their success, because we, too, want the world to be a better place. We offer a variety of strategic, creative, and technical services, including brand strategy, web design and development, and creative support.

We are a woman-owned and woman-led firm with a diverse staff. At Teal Media, we value our people above all else, and choose to work with partners and clients who share those beliefs.

What You'll Do
  • Create custom-coded websites built on open-source tools (WordPress and others) including primarily back-end theme creation and plugin development
  • Communicate and collaborate with internal and external project team members
  • Serve as lead developer on stand-alone web-based projects as well as support retainer development tasks for existing clients
  • Collaborate with and provide technical guidance to team members and clients
  • Work closely with our front-end developers
  • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs
  • Manage updates, changes, and feature additions to existing projects
  • Regularly consult with team members on code deliverables to ensure work meets project requirements before sharing with the client
  • Conduct quality assurance and testing on project deliverables
  • Assist with technical solutions discovery on projects
  • Train clients and/or internal team on how to manage and maintain all built functionality

Ideal Candidates Will Have
  • 3-7+ years of WordPress theme/plugin coding experience or equivalent
  • Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
  • Great attention and appreciation of the details
  • Understanding of the website design and development process, including working knowledge of git, mobile responsive design, and accessibility standards
  • Thrives working in a fast-paced environment
  • Bonus points: Experience working in an agency or with nonprofits.

Salary & Level

Teal Media is committed to equity and transparency when it comes to salary and the growth of our people. This role is open to both level 2T and 3T in our progression framework and is determined by the candidate's unique background and experience. 

Level: 3T

  • Official Title: Senior Developer
  • Department: Development
  • Salary Range: $100,000-$135,000

Level: 2T

  • Official Title: Developer
  • Department: Development
  • Salary Range: $90,000-$120,000

Benefits

Make a positive impact on mission-driven organizations and nonprofits while working in a fun, collaborative and flexible environment. We're a nimble, close-knit group that values team work and individual contribution.

All our positions are remote (in the US), but we work to maintain a fun and engaging company culture.

  • Work from home (or at the beach!)
  • Professional Development Coaching
  • Yearly Continuing Education Stipend
  • Eligibility for quarterly bonuses
  • 3 weeks of PTO and unlimited sick leave 
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Company 401(k) with match
  • Flexible working hours
  • Quarterly employee appreciation gifts 
  • Flex Fridays - a day dedicated to self-directed work. Spend time working on the things you want - whether it be honing in on your craft or taking off a few hours early for your mental wellness! 

Equal Opportunity Employer

If your experience doesn't exactly match the qualifications listed but you believe you would shine in this role, we want to hear from you! Please apply and tell us why you're the right person for the job.

Black & Indigenous people of color, immigrants, women and femmes, LGBTQI+ individuals, people with disabilities, neurodiverse people, and formerly incarcerated or systems-impacted people are highly encouraged to apply.

Teal Media is an equal opportunity employer that values a diverse workforce and an inclusive culture. Teal Media encourages applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, national origin, marital status, citizenship, disability, and veteran status.

Teal Media does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, country of origin, citizenship, ancestry, genetic information, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, political affiliation, exercising one's right to family care and medical leave, medical condition, including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and related medical conditions, or any other category protected by local, state, or federal laws. results.title: Sitecore Developer
results.description:
Senior Sitecore Developer

Location: Remote (must be in USA)

Responsibilities:

  • • Build content driven enterprise level web applications, implementing user interfaces and back-end functionality for both the client and authoring experiences
  • • Integrate with third-party systems by building web services, providers, and designing APIs

results.title: Interaction Engineer - AR
results.description:
DigitalFish has an immediate need for a Interaction Engineer - AR with professional experience in interactive games or interactive visualizations using Unity, ARKit and iOS.

As a Interaction Engineer with DigitalFish, you will develop next-generation technologies that define the future of digital-media creation and storytelling in AR. DigitalFish has long been a trusted partner of leading digital media companies, and we are at the center of their efforts to build a new generation of platforms and experiences. Current and past customers include Apple, Google, Meta, Disney, DreamWorks, Activision, Technicolor, ESPN, LEGO, NASA and many others.

Ideal candidates will have 3-5 years relevant production work experience, but if you think you're right for this position, contact us; we'll listen.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with the Creative Directors and design team to translate narrative ideas into compelling interactions
  • Rapidly prototype and iterate core game mechanics and interactions
  • Obsess over perfecting the feel and experience of those interactions until they are just right
  • Take ownership of technical issues and work to resolve them
  • Identify and reduce inefficiencies in the pipeline and tools
  • SparkAR experience a plus

Minimum Requirements

  • BS/BA in Computer Science or related field
  • Minimum 3 years experience using Unity in a commercial application
  • Experience creating apps using iOS and ARKit
  • Good understanding of linear algebra, image processing, and 3D graphics concepts
  • Strong general programming skills
  • Self-motivated with strong communications skills and able to work both in a team and independently
  • Proof of eligibility to work in the United States

Compensation and Benefits

  • Competitive salary plus equity per qualifications
  • Full benefits with excellent health plan
  • Ability to influence product and features in a cutting edge technology
  • Work with a well-respected, creative and talented group of experts in graphics and animation

Location

Our team is fully remote, working effectively together in real time. The ability to work on West Coast time zone is preferred.

Additional Info

Principals only, recruiting firms please do not contact us. We are an equal opportunity employer and are hiring immediately. 

DigitalFish is not able to sponsor immigration petitions for this role at this time. All applicants must have the right to work in the U.S. We look forward to hearing from you!
